japanese: ５年後――
translation: Five years later%p-2;――

japanese: いらっしゃ――
translation: Welcome%p-2;――

japanese: って、あんたたちか。
translation: Oh, it's you guys.

japanese: 一花、おかえりー！
translation: Ichika, welcome back!

japanese: 久しぶり。
translation: Been a while.

japanese:
久しぶり、３人とも。
元気そうでよかった。
translation:
It's good to see you guys. 
And you're in a good shape as well.

japanese: それにお店も大繁盛のようで。
translation: And I see the shop is obviously bursting at the seams with customers.

japanese: へー、さすがアメリカかぶれはジョークがお上手ねぇ。
translation: Yeah, yeah, and here I thought you were better at those sarcastic American-style jokes.

japanese:
もう、二乃ってば。
わざわざアメリカから二乃のために来てくれたのに。
translation:
Oh, come on, Nino.
She came all the way from America just for you.

japanese:
ために、なんてことはないよ？
絶対に来るつもりだったし。
translation:
It wasn't just for Nino, you know?
I planned to come no matter what.

japanese: 二乃も気にしないで、その調子でいいからねー。
translation:
And don't worry about it, Nino.
You're doing great as you are.

japanese: 別に、私はいつも通りよ。
translation: I'm as usual you know.

japanese:
そうですなぁ。
花嫁さんはいつも通りで落ち着いてますなぁ。
translation:
That's right.
The bride is calm, as she always is.

japanese:
いつも通りすぎだよー。
今日くらい、お店、お休みにしても
よかったんじゃない？
translation:
You're just too calm Nino.
You should have taken the day off from the shop today.

japanese:
三玖が１人でも店を開けるって言うからよ。
任せておいたらどうなることやら。
translation:
Miku said she could handle the shop on her own,
so I left it to her.
Who knows what will happen if she's in charge.

japanese: だから四葉にも手伝いに来てもらった。
translation: So, Yotsuba came to help too.

japanese:
四葉にできるのはフロアの仕事だけでしょ？
料理するのは全部あんたじゃない。
translation:
Yotsuba can only handle the floor work, right?
You're the one who does all the cooking.

japanese: だから、それももう平気だって言ってる。
translation: We're telling you, things are going to be fine.

japanese:
そもそも二乃、結婚したら
フータローの所へ行くんだから。
translation:
Besides, Nino, once you get married,
you'll go to Futaro's place.

japanese: そっか、そういう話になってたんだっけ。
translation: Oh, that's right, we talked about that.

japanese:
二乃、自分がいなくても大丈夫なように
みっちり料理を教えてたじゃない。
translation:
Nino, you taught us how to cook
so we could manage the cafe without you, remember?

japanese: けど、この子はどうも危なっかしいのよ。
translation: But this girl is always so clumsy.

japanese:
そう思ってるのは二乃だけ。
いい加減に妹離れして。
translation:
You're the only one who thinks that, Nino.
Grow up already.

japanese: はあっ！？
translation: Huh?!

japanese:
あはは！
言われちゃったねぇ。
translation:
Ahaha!
She really came at you, eh.

japanese: お店、これからは四葉が手伝うの？
translation: Will you help in the shop from now on, Yotsuba?

japanese:
うん、ちょくちょく来るつもり。
五月もやる？
translation:
Yeah, I plan to come help occasionally.
How about you, Itsuki?

japanese:
なに言ってるの。
五月は学校の先生なのよ？
そんな暇、あるわけないじゃない。
translation:
What are you talking about?
Itsuki is a schoolteacher, you know?
She doesn't have that kind of time.

japanese:
うん、ちょっと難しいかな。
ごめん。
translation:
Yeah, it might be a little difficult.
Sorry.

japanese:
いいのよ。
せっかく念願の職業に就いたんだから、
そっちに全力を注ぎなさい。
translation:
That's okay.
You finally got your dream job,
so put all your efforts into that.

japanese:
あと、四葉も。
ここの手伝いより
自分のやりたいことを優先しなさいよね。
translation:
And you too, Yotsuba.
Prioritize what you really want to do
over helping out here.

japanese:
三玖も、四葉やらいはちゃんに頼らないで
バイトを雇うことも真剣に考えなさい。
translation:
You too, Miku, consider hiring part-time workers
instead of relying only on Yotsuba and Raiha-chan.

japanese:
身内ばかりに頼ってると、
いざという時に困るかもしれないわ。
translation:
If you only rely on family,
you may be in trouble when something happens.

japanese:
おやおや。
これはやっぱり妹離れが必要かな。
translation:
Oh my, oh my.
Maybe we really need to grow up.

japanese:
だ、だから！　お店が心配なの！
せっかく常連さんも増えて
軌道に乗ったところなのよ？
translation:
Th-that's why! I'm worried about the shop!
We finally have more regulars,
and things are starting to look up.

japanese:
この場所を貸してくれたお父さんを
ガッカリさせないようにしておきたいの。
translation:
I want to make sure we don't disappoint Futaro's dad,
who lent us this place.

japanese:
わかってる。
あとは任せて、二乃。
translation:
I understand.
Leave it to me, Nino.

japanese:
……ええ。
頼んだわよ三玖。
translation:
...Okay.
I'm counting on you, Miku.

japanese:
そのうち東京に、なかの２号店を出して
二乃をビックリさせちゃったりして。
translation:
Maybe someday we can open
a second 'NAKANO' store in Tokyo,
and surprise you, Nino.

japanese:
あら、そうなったら
２号店で働いてあげてもいいわよ？
translation:
Oh, if that happens,
I can work at the second store too, you know?

japanese: ふふ、大きな夢だね。
translation: Teehee, that's a big dream.

japanese:
さて。
あまり長話してるわけにもいかないよ？
translation:
Well then.
We can't talk for too long, can we?

japanese:
これ。
お母さんの形見のピアス。
translation:
Here.
These are Mom's heirloom earrings.

japanese: これが私たちからの結婚祝い。
translation: This is our wedding gift to you, Nino.

japanese:
じゃあ、いくよ。
せーの──
translation:
Alright, here we go.
One, two, three!

japanese: 二乃、結婚おめでとう！
translation: Nino, congratulations on getting married!

japanese: ……ありがと。
translation: Thanks.

japanese: 二乃が預かってたほうは？
translation: What about the ones you were holding onto, Nino?

japanese:
持ってきてる。
結局、今日までしまったままだったわね。
translation:
I brought them.
It turns out I had them in storage until today.

japanese: ピアスホールは……あれ、あるんだ？
translation: Are your piercings still there? Oh, they are?

japanese:
ええ。
風太郎に頼んで開けてもらったの。
translation:
Yes.
I asked Futaro to help me open them.

japanese:
まさか、５年越しに
開けてもらうことになるなんてね。
translation:
I never thought I'd end up
opening them five years later.

japanese:
５年越し？
なになに、初耳なんだけど。
translation:
Five years later?
What are you talking about, now?

japanese:
昔、あんたにピアッサー借りたでしょ？
その時、風太郎に開けてもらおうとしたのよ。
translation:
Remember when you borrowed my piercer?
I wanted Futaro to help me pierce my ears then.

japanese: そうだったんだ。
translation: Oh, that's right.

japanese: まあ、結局、開けないで終わったんだけど。
translation: Well, we never pierced my ears with them.

japanese: どうして？
translation: Why not?

japanese:
それは……その、なんでもいいでしょ？
なんとなく開ける気分じゃなくなったから止めたの。
translation:
That's... Well, it doesn't matter, right?
I just didn't feel like opening them for some reason.

japanese: 本当は怖かったんじゃない？
translation: Weren't you just scared?

japanese:
違うわよ。
言ったでしょ、
花嫁衣装を着るまでに開ければいいって。
translation:
No, that's not it.
I told you, I said I would get them pierced
by the time I wore my wedding dress.

japanese: ああそっか、言ってたね。
translation: Oh, that's right, you did say that.

japanese:
お願いしようとした上杉君が、
５年後に花婿になる人だったなんてね。
translation:
It's funny that Uesugi-kun,
who tried to help me do that back then,
is the groom, five years later.

japanese: ロマンチックだしラブラブだー。
translation: It's romantic. So lovey-dovey.

japanese: そうよ、私と風太郎はラブラブなの。
translation: Yes, Futaro and I are very lovey-dovey.

japanese: ……ご馳走さま。
translation: ...Thank you for the display.

japanese:
本当は、私たちで
開けてあげるつもりだったんだけど。
translation:
We actually planned
to pierce your ears ourselves.

japanese:
残念だな、楽しみにしてたのに。
そんなところまでフータロー君にとられちゃったか。
translation:
It's a shame, that Futaro-kun beat us to it. 
We were looking forward to pierce your ears.

japanese: おあいにく様ね。
translation: Too bad for you.

japanese:
じゃあ、そろそろ、
その花婿さんが待ってる会場に行こうか。
translation:
Well then, shall we head to the venue
where the groom is waiting?

japanese: 諸々の準備があるし。
translation: There are some preparations to be made.

japanese:
そうだ、私のメイクさん来てくれてるよ。
衣装も準備できてるって。
translation:
Right, my makeup artist is here right now.
My dress is also ready.

japanese:
二乃、本当にやるの？
大丈夫？
translation:
Nino, are you sure about this?
Are you okay?

japanese:
私がいいって言ってるんだから大丈夫よ。
やると決めたからにはやるわ。
translation:
I said it's what I want, so I'll be fine.
Once I've made up my mind, I'll see it through.

japanese:
だね。
上杉君には確かめておかないと。
translation:
That's right.
We'll have to have Uesugi-kun confirm it.

japanese: フータロー、どんな顔するかな。
translation: I wonder what kind of expression Futaro will make.

japanese:
きっとすごく怒るわよ。
なにやってんだ、お前らーって。
translation:
He'll probably be really angry.
Like, 'what the heck are you guys doing?'
